object.name: ReplyParameters
object.description: Describes reply parameters for the message that is being sent.
object.html_description: Describes reply parameters for the message that is being sent.
object.rst_description: Describes reply parameters for the message that is being sent.

annotations.description: Identifier of the message that will be replied to in the current chat, or in the chat chat_id if it is specified
annotations.html_description: Identifier of the message that will be replied to in the current chat, or in the chat chat_id if it is specified
annotations.rst_description: Identifier of the message that will be replied to in the current chat, or in the chat *chat_id* if it is specified
annotations.name: message_id

annotations.description: If the message to be replied to is from a different chat, unique identifier for the chat or username of the channel (in the format @channelusername). Not supported for messages sent on behalf of a business account.
annotations.html_description: Optional. If the message to be replied to is from a different chat, unique identifier for the chat or username of the channel (in the format @channelusername). Not supported for messages sent on behalf of a business account.
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. If the message to be replied to is from a different chat, unique identifier for the chat or username of the channel (in the format :code:`@channelusername`). Not supported for messages sent on behalf of a business account.
annotations.name: chat_id

annotations.description: Pass True if the message should be sent even if the specified message to be replied to is not found. Always False for replies in another chat or forum topic. Always True for messages sent on behalf of a business account.
annotations.html_description: Optional. Pass True if the message should be sent even if the specified message to be replied to is not found. Always False for replies in another chat or forum topic. Always True for messages sent on behalf of a business account.
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. Pass :code:`True` if the message should be sent even if the specified message to be replied to is not found. Always :code:`False` for replies in another chat or forum topic. Always :code:`True` for messages sent on behalf of a business account.
annotations.name: allow_sending_without_reply

annotations.description: Quoted part of the message to be replied to; 0-1024 characters after entities parsing. The quote must be an exact substring of the message to be replied to, including bold, italic, underline, strikethrough, spoiler, and custom_emoji entities. The message will fail to send if the quote isn't found in the original message.
annotations.html_description: Optional. Quoted part of the message to be replied to; 0-1024 characters after entities parsing. The quote must be an exact substring of the message to be replied to, including bold, italic, underline, strikethrough, spoiler, and custom_emoji entities. The message will fail to send if the quote isn't found in the original message.
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. Quoted part of the message to be replied to; 0-1024 characters after entities parsing. The quote must be an exact substring of the message to be replied to, including *bold*, *italic*, *underline*, *strikethrough*, *spoiler*, and *custom_emoji* entities. The message will fail to send if the quote isn't found in the original message.
annotations.name: quote

annotations.description: Mode for parsing entities in the quote. See formatting options for more details.
annotations.html_description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the quote. See formatting options for more details.
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. Mode for parsing entities in the quote. See `formatting options <https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options>`_ for more details.
annotations.name: quote_parse_mode

annotations.description: A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in the quote. It can be specified instead of quote_parse_mode.
annotations.html_description: Optional. A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in the quote. It can be specified instead of quote_parse_mode.
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in the quote. It can be specified instead of *quote_parse_mode*.
annotations.name: quote_entities

annotations.description: Position of the quote in the original message in UTF-16 code units
annotations.html_description: Optional. Position of the quote in the original message in UTF-16 code units
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. Position of the quote in the original message in UTF-16 code units
annotations.name: quote_position
